title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Saturday, September 2 (game #586)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Free decryptor released for Key Group ransomware
description: Error allowed cybersecurity pros to create a Key Group ransomware decryptor and save victim's files.

title: Intel is having a nightmare as Arc GPUs reportedly fail to run Starfield – at all
description: This really isn’t good – those with Intel Arc GPUs are complaining in droves that the game doesn’t even launch.

title: Apple iMac Pro M3 (2023): all the latest news and rumors
description: Now that we have an Apple silicon Mac Pro, it might be time for Apple to bring the iMac Pro back from the dead.

title: Top workplace safety organization leaked user details from NASA, Tesla, DoJ, and more
description: Sensitive info on thousands of firms taken, including government organizations and high-profile enterprises.

title: AMD RX 7800 XT leak has some gamers disappointed – but let’s not get carried away
description: A new leak has poured cold water on AMD’s RX 7800 XT for some PC gamers, but we don’t think that’s fair.

title: 7 new movies and TV shows on Netflix, Max, Prime Video and more this weekend (September 1)
description: From brand new live-action anime adventures to returning fantasy series, there’s plenty to watch this weekend.

title: Forever 21 data breach sees thousands of victims affected
description: Hackers stole data on current and former Forever 21 employees, including Social Security Numbers.

title: Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra leak reveals more about its 200MP camera
description: The Galaxy S24 Ultra is said to be running an "optimized" version of the 200MP camera inside the S23 Ultra.

title: Microsoft reminds Windows 11 users on original version that they’ll soon be forced to upgrade
description: Come October, support runs out for Windows 11 21H2, and you’ll be automatically upgraded by Microsoft.

title: Keeper is now bringing your passkeys straight to the browser
description: Keeper Security expands passkey support for all desktop browsers.

title: Google Chrome just made it ridiculously easy to capture frames from videos
description: There's now an easier way to grab still images from video clips – as long as you're using YouTube, at least.

title: Microsoft Teams will no longer be a part of Office for some users
description: Unbundling Teams will mean it can continue to sell Microsoft 365 in Europe.

title: Windows 11 gets a bunch of small but useful changes – including something nifty for Notepad
description: Microsoft has had a busy week tinkering under the bonnet with Windows 11 and some of its default apps.

description: A new, collaborative note-taking pane is set to grace your Zoom meetings to save you having to open Word.

title: I saw a pool-safe portable 15-inch TV, and now I want one for my bathroom
description: Sylvox's waterproof TV floats in water, and supports streaming services or HDMI.

title: Nvidia cuts price of RTX 4060 Ti 16GB undercut AMD’s RX 7700 XT GPU launch
description: A 10% price drop for the RTX 4060 Ti 16GB is a welcome sight, even if it arguably should have been this price from the start.

title: LogicMonitor customers hit by data breach following poor password policy
description: Default passwords were weak and LogicMonitor customers got hurt, reports claim.

title: The iPhone 16 might have a brighter screen and better battery life

title: Many workers are faking knowledge of AI to make sure they aren't left behind
description: Many companies are not giving their workers enough training to understand and benefit from AI tools.

description: The Sony Xperia 5 V offers up Sony's latest 'Exmor T for mobile' imaging in a smaller package but ditches a telephoto sensor altogether.

title: Lenovo Legion Go is the powerhouse the handheld gaming market was missing
description: The Legion Go hits the scene its powerful hardware and removable controllers with 10 configurable buttons.
